Keys: `time` (string), `duration_to_add` (string), `date` (string), `label` (string), `recurrence` (array), `state_operation` (string: ENABLE/DISABLE/DELETE/CANCEL/DISMISS/STOP/PAUSE/SNOOZE)\\n\\u2022 `bulk_operation` (optional): Boolean, set true to modify multiple alarms without confirmation\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Change morning alarm time: `filters: {time: \\\"7:00 AM\\\"}, modifications: {time: \\\"7:30 AM\\\"}`\\n- Add 30 minutes to alarm: `filters: {alarm_ids: [\\\"ALARM-1\\\"]}, modifications: {duration_to_add: \\\"30m\\\"}`\\n- Disable all alarms on specific date: `filters: {date: \\\"2024-01-15\\\"}, modifications: {state_operation: \\\"DISABLE\\\"}, bulk_operation: true`\\n- Update recurrence: `filters: {label: \\\"meeting\\\"}, modifications: {recurrence: [\\\"MONDAY\\\", \\\"WEDNESDAY\\\"]}`\\n- Delete specific alarm: `filters: {alarm_ids: [\\\"ALARM-5\\\"]}, modifications: {state_operation: \\\"DELETE\\\"}`\\n- Change label: `filters: {time: \\\"8:30 AM\\\"}, modifications: {label: \\\"Updated reminder\\\"}`\\n\\n**State Changes:**\\n- For DELETE: Removes alarm from database entirely\\n- For other state operations: Updates alarm state field (ENABLE\\u2192ACTIVE, DISABLE\\u2192DISABLED, etc.)\\n- For time/date/duration changes: Recalculates fire_time\\n- For label/recurrence: Updates respective fields\\n\\n**Returns:** \\n- If successful, a message indicating success with count of modified/deleted alarms, and array of affected alarm objects with updated properties.\\n- If no filters provided and not bulk_operation, returns all alarms to select from\\n- If multiple matches without bulk_operation, returns matches for clarification\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>modify_alarm</summary>\\n\\nLegacy wrapper for modify_alarm_v2. Modifies alarm time, label, or duration using simplified parameters. Converts parameters to v2 format internally.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `query` (optional): Time or label to identify alarm\\n\\u2022 `alarm_type` (optional): UPCOMING, ACTIVE, or DISABLED\\n\\u2022 `new_time_of_day` (optional): New time in strict HH:MM:SS format (24-hour)\\n\\u2022 `new_am_pm_or_unknown` (optional): AM, PM, or UNKNOWN\\n\\u2022 `new_label` (optional): New label text\\n\\u2022 `alarm_ids` (optional): Array of alarm IDs\\n\\u2022 `duration_to_add` (optional): Duration to add (e.g., \\\"30m\\\")\\n\\u2022 `date` (optional): Filter by date (YYYY-MM-DD)\\n\\u2022 `new_date` (optional): New date to set (YYYY-MM-DD)\\n\\u2022 `new_recurrence` (optional): Array of day names\\n\\u2022 `bulk_operation` (optional): Boolean for bulk mode\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Change time with 24-hour format: `query: \\\"morning\\\", new_time_of_day: \\\"08:00:00\\\"`\\n- Modify with date: `alarm_ids: [\\\"ALARM-1\\\"], new_date: \\\"2024-02-15\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Same as modify_alarm_v2 (converts parameters and delegates to v2).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>change_alarm_state</summary>\\n\\nChanges alarm state using state operations without modifying other properties. Wrapper around modify_alarm_v2 focused on state changes.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `alarm_ids` (optional): Array of alarm IDs to modify\\n\\u2022 `alarm_type` (optional): Filter by UPCOMING, ACTIVE, or DISABLED\\n\\u2022 `time_of_day` (optional): Filter by time in HH:MM:SS format\\n\\u2022 `am_pm_or_unknown` (optional): AM, PM, or UNKNOWN\\n\\u2022 `label` (optional): Filter by label\\n\\u2022 `state_operation` (required): ENABLE, DISABLE, DELETE, CANCEL, DISMISS, STOP, PAUSE, or SNOOZE\\n\\u2022 `date` (optional): Filter by specific date\\n\\u2022 `start_date` (optional): Filter by date range start\\n\\u2022 `end_date` (optional): Filter by date range end\\n\\u2022 `bulk_operation` (optional): Boolean for bulk mode\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Disable specific alarm: `alarm_ids: [\\\"ALARM-2\\\"], state_operation: \\\"DISABLE\\\"`\\n- Enable all disabled alarms: `alarm_type: \\\"DISABLED\\\", state_operation: \\\"ENABLE\\\", bulk_operation: true`\\n- Delete old alarms: `end_date: \\\"2024-01-10\\\", state_operation: \\\"DELETE\\\", bulk_operation: true`\\n- Pause firing alarms: `alarm_type: \\\"ACTIVE\\\", state_operation: \\\"PAUSE\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates alarm state field according to operation (ENABLE\\u2192ACTIVE, DISABLE\\u2192DISABLED, etc.). DELETE removes alarm from database.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success message with count and array of affected alarms showing updated state.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>snooze</summary>\\n\\nSnoozes currently firing alarms for specified duration or until specific time. Only affects alarms in FIRING state.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `time` (optional): Time to snooze until. Supports 12-hour (\\\"7:30 AM\\\") and 24-hour (\\\"14:30\\\") formats\\n\\u2022 `duration` (optional): Snooze duration in seconds (e.g., 300 for 5 minutes, 600 for 10 minutes).\\n- NOTE: If neither time nor duration is specified, defaults to a duration of 10 minutes (600 seconds)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Snooze for 10 minutes (default): `{}` (no parameters)\\n- Snooze for 5 minutes: `duration: 300`\\n- Snooze until specific time: `time: \\\"7:45 AM\\\"`\\n- Snooze for 15 minutes: `duration: 900`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates firing alarms: sets state to SNOOZED, calculates new fire_time (current time + duration or specified time), updates time_of_day and date fields. If snooze time is in past, advances to next day.\\n\\n**Returns:** If no firing alarms: message \\\"No firing alarms found to snooze\\\" with empty array. If successful: message with count of snoozed alarms and array of alarm objects with updated fire times.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>snooze_alarm</summary>\\n\\nLegacy wrapper for the preferred tool `snooze`. Converts time format parameters to snooze() format. Snoozes currently firing alarms for specified duration or until specific time. Only affects alarms in FIRING state.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `snooze_duration` (optional): Duration in seconds as string (e.g., \\\"300\\\")\\n\\u2022 `snooze_till_time_of_day` (optional): Time in strict HH:MM:SS format\\n\\u2022 `am_pm_or_unknown` (optional): AM, PM, or UNKNOWN\\n- NOTE: If neither time nor duration is specified, defaults to a duration of 10 minutes (600 seconds)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Snooze for 5 minutes: `snooze_duration: \\\"300\\\"`\\n- Snooze until time: `snooze_till_time_of_day: \\\"08:00:00\\\", am_pm_or_unknown: \\\"AM\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates firing alarms: sets state to SNOOZED, calculates new fire_time, updates time_of_day and date fields. If snooze time is in past, advances to next day.\\n\\n**Returns:** If no firing alarms: message \\\"No firing alarms found to snooze\\\" with empty array. If successful: message with count of snoozed alarms and array of alarm objects with updated fire times.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_clock</summary>\\n\\nGeneric clock creator that routes to either create_alarm or create_timer based on type parameter. Slightly less efficient than either one used in isolation.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `type` (required): \\\"TIMER\\\" or \\\"ALARM\\\"\\n\\u2022 `duration` (optional): Duration string (e.g., \\\"10m\\\", \\\"1h30m\\\")\\n\\u2022 `time_of_day` (optional): Time in strict HH:MM:SS format (24-hour)\\n\\u2022 `am_pm_or_unknown` (optional): AM, PM, or UNKNOWN\\n\\u2022 `date` (optional): Date in YYYY-MM-DD format (alarms only)\\n\\u2022 `label` (optional): Descriptive label\\n\\u2022 `recurrence` (optional): Array of day names (alarms only)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create timer: `type: \\\"TIMER\\\", duration: \\\"25m\\\", label: \\\"Pomodoro\\\"`\\n- Create alarm: `type: \\\"ALARM\\\", time_of_day: \\\"07:00:00\\\", am_pm_or_unknown: \\\"AM\\\", label: \\\"Wake up\\\"`\\n- Create recurring alarm: `type: \\\"ALARM\\\", time_of_day: \\\"09:00:00\\\", recurrence: [\\\"MONDAY\\\", \\\"FRIDAY\\\"]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Delegates to create_alarm() or create_timer() based on type. Creates new alarm or timer with appropriate default state.\\n\\n**Returns:** Alarm object (if type=\\\"ALARM\\\") or timer object (if type=\\\"TIMER\\\") with all standard fields populated.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_timer</summary>\\n\\nCreates a new countdown timer with specified duration or target time. Generates unique timer ID automatically. \\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `duration` (optional): Timer duration (e.g., \\\"10m\\\", \\\"1h30m45s\\\"). Format: \\\"{hours}h{minutes}m{seconds}s\\\"\\n\\u2022 `time` (optional): Time when timer should fire. Accepts 12-hour (\\\"2:30 PM\\\") or 24-hour (\\\"14:30\\\") formats\\n\\u2022 `label` (optional): Descriptive label for timer identification\\n- NOTE: Must provide either duration OR time (if both, duration takes precedence)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Quick 10-minute timer: `duration: \\\"10m\\\"`\\n- Pomodoro timer: `duration: \\\"25m\\\", label: \\\"Work session\\\"`\\n- Timer until specific time: `time: \\\"3:00 PM\\\", label: \\\"Meeting reminder\\\"`\\n- Cooking timer: `duration: \\\"45m\\\", label: \\\"Baking cookies\\\"`\\n- Short timer with seconds: `duration: \\\"2m30s\\\", label: \\\"Tea steeping\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new timer to timers dictionary with generated TIMER-{N} ID, sets state to RUNNING, calculates fire_time, sets original_duration and remaining_duration to same value, records start_time and created_at timestamps.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success message with duration and single-item array containing the new timer object with timer_id, original_duration, remaining_duration, time_of_day, label, state, and fire_time.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>modify_timer_v2</summary>\\n\\nModifies one or multiple timers' properties including duration, label, or state. Supports filtering and bulk operations.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `filters` (optional): Dictionary to identify timers. Keys: `duration` (string), `label` (string), `timer_type` (string: UPCOMING/RUNNING/PAUSED), `timer_ids` (array)\\n\\u2022 `modifications` (optional): Dictionary specifying changes. Keys: `duration` (string - resets timer), `duration_to_add` (string - adds to original), `label` (string), `state_operation` (string: PAUSE/RESUME/RESET/DELETE/CANCEL/DISMISS/STOP)\\n\\u2022 `bulk_operation` (optional): Boolean, set true to modify multiple timers without confirmation\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Extend timer by 5 minutes: `filters: {timer_ids: [\\\"TIMER-1\\\"]}, modifications: {duration_to_add: \\\"5m\\\"}`\\n- Reset timer to new duration: `filters: {label: \\\"cooking\\\"}, modifications: {duration: \\\"15m\\\"}`\\n- Pause all running timers: `filters: {timer_type: \\\"RUNNING\\\"}, modifications: {state_operation: \\\"PAUSE\\\"}, bulk_operation: true`\\n- Resume specific timer: `filters: {timer_ids: [\\\"TIMER-2\\\"]}, modifications: {state_operation: \\\"RESUME\\\"}`\\n- Delete finished timers: `filters: {timer_type: \\\"PAUSED\\\"}, modifications: {state_operation: \\\"DELETE\\\"}, bulk_operation: true`\\n- Change timer label: `filters: {timer_ids: [\\\"TIMER-1\\\"]}, modifications: {label: \\\"Updated label\\\"}`\\n\\n**State Changes:**\\n- duration: Resets timer with new original_duration, updates remaining_duration, resets start_time to now\\n- duration_to_add: Adds to original_duration, updates both original and remaining, resets start_time\\n- label: Updates label field\\n- state_operation RESET: Resets remaining_duration to original_duration, updates start_time\\n- state_operation RESUME: Sets state to RUNNING, updates start_time to now\\n- state_operation PAUSE: Sets state to PAUSED, preserves remaining_duration\\n- state_operation DELETE: Removes timer from database\\n\\n**Returns:**\\n- If successful, a message with count of modified/deleted timers and array of affected timer objects with updated properties. Deleted timers appear in response then are removed from database.\\n- If no filters applied and not bulk_operation, returns all timers for clarification\\n- If multiple matches without bulk_operation, returns matches for clarification\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>modify_timer</summary>\\n\\nLegacy wrapper for modify_timer_v2. Modifies timer duration or label using simplified parameters.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `query` (optional): Duration or label to identify timer\\n\\u2022 `timer_type` (optional): UPCOMING, RUNNING, or PAUSED\\n\\u2022 `new_duration` (optional): New total duration (resets timer)\\n\\u2022 `duration_to_add` (optional): Duration to add to current timer\\n\\u2022 `new_label` (optional): New label text\\n\\u2022 `timer_ids` (optional): Array of timer IDs\\n\\u2022 `bulk_operation` (optional): Boolean for bulk mode\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Change duration by label: `query: \\\"cooking\\\", new_duration: \\\"20m\\\"`\\n- Add time to timer: `timer_ids: [\\\"TIMER-1\\\"], duration_to_add: \\\"10m\\\"`\\n- Update multiple timer labels: `timer_type: \\\"RUNNING\\\", new_label: \\\"Active\\\", bulk_operation: true`\\n\\n**Returns:** \\n- If successful, a message with count of modified/deleted timers and array of affected timer objects with updated properties. Deleted timers appear in response then are removed from database.\\n- If no filters applied and not bulk_operation, returns all timers for clarification\\n- If multiple matches without bulk_operation, returns matches for clarification\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>change_timer_state</summary>\\n\\nChanges timer state using state operations without modifying other properties. Wrapper around modify_timer_v2 focused on state changes.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `timer_ids` (optional): Array of timer IDs to modify\\n\\u2022 `timer_type` (optional): Filter by UPCOMING, RUNNING, or PAUSED\\n\\u2022 `duration` (optional): Filter by duration\\n\\u2022 `label` (optional): Filter by label\\n\\u2022 `state_operation` (optional): PAUSE, RESUME, RESET, DELETE, CANCEL, DISMISS, or STOP\\n\\u2022 `bulk_operation` (optional): Boolean for bulk mode\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Pause specific timer: `timer_ids: [\\\"TIMER-1\\\"], state_operation: \\\"PAUSE\\\"`\\n- Resume all paused timers: `timer_type: \\\"PAUSED\\\", state_operation: \\\"RESUME\\\", bulk_operation: true`\\n- Reset timer: `timer_ids: [\\\"TIMER-3\\\"], state_operation: \\\"RESET\\\"`\\n- Delete all stopped timers: `timer_type: \\\"PAUSED\\\", state_operation: \\\"DELETE\\\", bulk_operation: true`\\n- Cancel running timer: `label: \\\"break\\\", state_operation: \\\"CANCEL\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates timer state according to operation. RESET restores remaining_duration to original_duration and updates start_time. RESUME updates start_time to now. DELETE removes from database.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success message with count and array of affected timers showing updated state.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>start_stopwatch</summary>\\n\\nStarts or resumes the stopwatch. If stopped, starts fresh with zero time. If paused, resumes from elapsed time.\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Start fresh timing session (when stopped)\\n- Resume timing after pause\\n- Restart stopwatch that's already running (becomes no-op, returns current elapsed)\\n\\n**State Changes:**\\n- If STOPPED: Sets state to RUNNING, resets elapsed_time to 0, clears lap_times, records start_time\\n- If PAUSED: Sets state to RUNNING, calculates new start_time by subtracting elapsed_time from current time, clears pause_time\\n- If RUNNING: No change, returns current elapsed time\\n\\n**Returns:** Message indicating \\\"Stopwatch started\\\" (from stopped), \\\"Stopwatch resumed\\\" (from paused), or \\\"Stopwatch is already running\\\" with current elapsed time in \\\"Xh Ym Zs\\\" format.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>pause_stopwatch</summary>\\n\\nPauses the currently running stopwatch, preserving elapsed time.\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Pause during timing session to freeze elapsed time\\n- Stop timing temporarily without losing progress\\n\\n**State Changes:**\\n- If RUNNING: Sets state to PAUSED, records pause_time, calculates and stores elapsed_time as integer seconds\\n- If PAUSED: No change, returns current elapsed time\\n- If STOPPED: No change, returns error message\\n\\n**Returns:** Message \\\"Stopwatch paused at Xh Ym Zs\\\" (from running), \\\"Stopwatch is already paused\\\" (if paused), or \\\"Stopwatch is not running\\\" (if stopped), with elapsed time included.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>reset_stopwatch</summary>\\n\\nResets stopwatch to zero and clears all lap times. Returns to STOPPED state.\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Clear stopwatch to start fresh session\\n- Remove all lap times\\n- Reset after completing timing session\\n\\n**State Changes:** Resets entire stopwatch state: sets state to STOPPED, clears start_time, pause_time, sets elapsed_time to 0, empties lap_times array.\\n\\n**Returns:** Message \\\"Stopwatch reset to 00:00:00\\\" regardless of previous state.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>lap_stopwatch</summary>\\n\\nRecords a lap time while stopwatch continues running. Captures both split time (since last lap) and total elapsed time.\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Record lap during running workout\\n- Mark checkpoint times in activity\\n- Track intervals during exercise\\n- Split times during race\\n\\n**State Changes:**\\n- If RUNNING: Adds lap entry to lap_times array with lap_number, lap_time (total elapsed), split_time (since last lap), timestamp, and formatted duration strings. Updates elapsed_time.\\n- If PAUSED or STOPPED: No change, returns error message\\n\\n**Returns:**\\n- If running: \\\"Lap N recorded: Xh Ym Zs (Total: Xh Ym Zs)\\\" where N is lap number, first duration is split time, second is total elapsed\\n- If paused: \\\"Cannot record lap time while stopwatch is paused. Resume the stopwatch first.\\\"\\n- If stopped: \\\"Cannot record lap time. Stopwatch is not running.\\\"\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n</details>\\n\"\n                }\n                ,\n                {\n                    name: \"device_actions\",\n \"followed_users\": {}}, \"timezoneOffset\": \"-05:00\"},\n                    propsJsonPrev: null,\n                    bundleUrl: \"https://agent-tools-11866-a72f0a4c-vrd7x608.onporter.run/static/bundle.js\",\n                    docsRaw: \"<style>\\ndetails summary {\\n    padding: 8px;\\n    border-radius: 4px;\\n    margin: 4px 0;\\n    cursor: pointer;\\n    font-weight: bold;\\n}\\ndetails[open] {\\n    border: 1px solid #ddd;\\n    border-radius: 4px;\\n    padding: 8px;\\n    margin: 8px 0;\\n}\\ndetails details {\\n    margin-left: 16px;\\n    border-left: 2px solid #ddd;\\n    padding-left: 8px;\\n}\\n.overview { background-color: #d8eeffff; }\\n.documentation { background-color: #fbe9ffff; }\\n.data-structure { background-color: #fbefffff; border-left: 3px solid #6c757d; }\\n.read-tools { background-color: #dcffe0ff; }\\n.write-tools { background-color: #ffe8c2ff; }\\n.tool { background-color: #f8f9fa; border-left: 3px solid #6c757d; }\\n</style>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"overview\\\">\\n<summary>\\ud83d\\udd0d Service Overview</summary>\\n\\nThe Spotify service does not control music streaming, but manages user libraries and music exploration. Users can save albums, follow artists and playlists, and discover new music through recommendations or browsing albums, artists, and playlists in a broader catalog. Any content you want to use in your task must be present in the initial Spotify database.\\n\\nMany search tools have limitations - please familiarize yourself with how this service works in practice!\\n\\n**Key Features:**\\n- **Music Catalog**: Browse and retrieve albums, artists, tracks with detailed metadata including popularity, genres, release dates, and market availability\\n- **User Library**: Save and manage albums in personal library with timestamps\\n- **User Profiles**: Access user details, including email and subscription type\\n- **Playlists**: Create, modify, and manage playlists with control over tracks, podcast episodes, metadata, and privacy settings\\n- **Social Features**: Follow/unfollow artists, users, and playlists with ability to check follow status\\n- **Discovery**: Browse categories, featured playlists, new releases, and get recommendations (note: some discovery features have simulation limitations - see specific tool documentation)\\n- **Search**: Search across multiple content types\\n- **Podcasts**: Search for podcast shows and episodes; add episodes to playlists alongside music tracks\\n- **Audiobooks**: Search for audiobooks in the catalog\\n\\n**High-Level Usage Patterns:**\\n- Create and curate playlists by adding/removing/reordering tracks and podcast episodes\\n- Build music library by saving favorite albums\\n- Follow favorite artists\\n- Search for specific songs, albums, artists, podcasts, or audiobooks across the catalog\\n- Access user listening statistics and preferences\\n\\n**Default Example DB Overview:**\\nThe default database contains 6 albums (including Test Album, Greatest Hits, Fresh Start), 6 artists (Test Artist, Popular Band, New Artist, UK Artist, Electronic Band, Indie Artist), 3 tracks, 3 playlists (Test Playlist with 2 tracks, Workout Mix, Chill Vibes), 2 users (Test User as current user with premium subscription, Another User), and 3 categories (Test Category, Workout, Chill). The current user (ID: smuqPNFPXrJKcEt943KrY8) has 2 saved albums, 2 top artists, and 2 top tracks in their profile.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"documentation\\\">\\n<summary>\\ud83d\\udcda Detailed Documentation</summary>\\n\\n## Core Concepts\\n\\n### The Spotify Catalog and the User Library\\nThe Spotify database represents the entirety of the accessible Spotify catalog, while the **user's personal library** consists of a subsection of entities within that catalog:\\n- Saved albums\\n- Top artists and tracks\\n- Created and followed playlists\\n\\nAny music, podcasts, etc., that you intend to use in any tasks must be present in the initial context, as the agent can only modify the user's personal library - not the Spotify catalog itself.\\n\\n### Albums, Artists, and Tracks\\n**Albums** contain metadata like name, artist(s), genres, release date, album type (album/single/compilation), total tracks, available markets, popularity score, and cover images. Albums are linked to artists and contain tracks.\\n\\nAlbums can be added or removed from the user's Saved Albums.\\n\\n**Artists** have profiles with name, genres, popularity score, follower count, and images. Artists can have albums, top tracks (by market), and related artists for discovery.\\n\\nArtists can be followed or unfollowed, and are tracked by listening history in the user's Top Artists.\\n\\n**Tracks** represent individual songs with name, artists, album reference, duration, explicit flag, and popularity. \\n\\nTracks can be added or removed from playlists, and are tracked by listening history in the user's Top Tracks.\\n\\n### Podcasts and Audiobooks\\n**Podcast Shows** represent podcast series that contain multiple episodes. Shows have metadata including name, publisher, description, available markets, and images. Shows can be found via `search_for_item`.\\n\\n**Podcast Episodes** represent individual podcast installments with name, description, duration, release date, and show reference. Episodes can be found via `search_for_item` and added to playlists.\\n\\n**Audiobooks** represent long-form audio content with narrator, author, and chapter information. Audiobooks can be found via `search_for_item`.\\n\\n### Playlists\\nPlaylists are user-created collections of tracks and podcast episodes. Key playlist concepts:\\n- **Ownership**: Each playlist has an owner (user) and can be collaborative\\n- **Privacy**: Playlists can be public or private\\n- **Snapshot IDs**: Every modification generates a new snapshot_id for optimistic concurrency control\\n- **Items**: Playlists contain ordered track and episode items with metadata (who added, when added)\\n- **Cover Images**: Playlists can have custom cover images (JPEG, max 256 KB, base64-encoded)\\n\\nThe agent can create and edit any playlist the user has ownership of, though it cannot delete a playlist.\\n\\n### Following\\nUsers can follow three types of entities, which the agent can control:\\n- **Artists**: Track favorite artists in the database\\n- **Users**: Track connections with other users; access their public playlists via get_user_playlists\\n- **Playlists**: Add playlist to library with public/private follow setting\\n\\n### User Library and Profiles\\n**Current User** (authenticated user) accessed via get_current_user_profile returns:\\n- Personal information: display name, email, country, subscription product type, explicit content settings\\n- Follower count and profile images\\n- External URLs to profile\\n\\n**Other Users** accessed via get_user_profile returns the complete user object from the database, and does not filter out private fields like email/subscription information.\\n\\n### Browse and Discovery\\nSeveral of the browse and discovery features are not fully functional (e.g. search for playlists with a given category will return all playlists, not only those with that category). Please check individual tools for details.\\n\\n**Categories** organize content into browsable sections (e.g., Workout, Chill).\\n\\n**Featured Playlists** can be retrieved with optional country/locale/timestamp filters.\\n\\n**New Releases** returns albums sorted by release date, filterable by country.\\n\\n**Recommendations** generate personalized track suggestions based on seed artists, tracks, or genres (up to 5 seeds combined, limit 100 tracks). **BUG: tool accepts these parameters but does not properly utilize them; see `get_recommendations` for more.**\\n\\n### Market Filtering\\nMany tools accept an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (e.g., \\\"US\\\", \\\"CA\\\", \\\"GB\\\") to filter content by regional availability. Albums and tracks may only be available in certain markets due to licensing.\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>Database Structure</summary>\\n\\nThe Spotify database contains multiple top-level collections storing music catalog, user data, and relationships:\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>albums</summary>\\n\\nCollection of album objects keyed by album ID (e.g., \\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\"). Albums represent music releases with metadata and track listings.\\n\\n**Album Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique album identifier(e.g., \\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\")\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Album title (e.g., \\\"Test Album\\\", \\\"Greatest Hits\\\")\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"album\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI for the album (e.g., \\\"spotify:album:4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\")\\n\\n**`href`**: (Required) API endpoint URL for this album\\n\\n**`external_urls`**: (Required) Object with external URLs, contains `spotify` key with web player URL\\n\\n**`artists`**: (Required) Array of simplified artist objects. Each contains:\\n- `id`: Artist ID\\n- `name`: Artist name\\n\\n**`album_type`**: (Required) Type of album - \\\"album\\\", \\\"single\\\", or \\\"compilation\\\"\\n\\n**`total_tracks`**: (Required) Number of tracks in the album (integer, e.g., 10, 15)\\n\\n**`available_markets`**: (Required) Array of ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes where album is available (e.g., [\\\"US\\\", \\\"CA\\\", \\\"UK\\\"])\\n\\n**`release_date`**: (Required) Release date string (e.g., \\\"2023-01-01\\\")\\n\\n**`release_date_precision`**: (Required) Precision of release date - \\\"year\\\", \\\"month\\\", or \\\"day\\\"\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of image objects with `url`, `height`, and `width`. May be empty\\n\\n**`popularity`**: (Required) Popularity score from 0-100 (integer)\\n\\n**`copyrights`**: (Required) Array of copyright objects. Each contains:\\n- `text`: Copyright statement\\n- `type`: \\\"C\\\" (copyright) or \\\"P\\\" (phonographic/performance copyright)\\n\\n**`external_ids`**: (Required) Object with external IDs like ISRC codes. Contains:\\n- `isrc`: International Standard Recording Code (e.g., \\\"USRC12345678\\\")\\n\\n**`label`**: (Required) Record label name (e.g., \\\"Test Label\\\")\\n\\n**`restrictions`**: (Required) Object containing market restrictions (usually empty)\\n\\n**`genres`**: (Required) Array of genre strings (may be empty)\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>artists</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of artist objects keyed by artist ID (e.g., \\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"). Artists represent musicians, bands, or performers.\\n\\n**Artist Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique artist identifier. Alphanumeric characters only (A-Z, a-z, 0-9). (e.g., \\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\")\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Artist or band name (e.g., \\\"Test Artist\\\", \\\"Popular Band\\\")\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"artist\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI (e.g., \\\"spotify:artist:W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\")\\n\\n**`href`**: (Required) API endpoint URL\\n\\n**`external_urls`**: (Required) Object with `spotify` web player URL\\n\\n**`followers`**: (Required) Object with follower count:\\n- `total`: Number of followers (integer, e.g., 1000, 50000)\\n\\n**`genres`**: (Required) Array of genre strings (e.g., [\\\"pop\\\"], [\\\"rock\\\", \\\"indie\\\"])\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of image objects (URL, height, width). May be empty\\n\\n**`popularity`**: (Required) Popularity score 0-100 (integer)\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>tracks</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of track (song) objects keyed by track ID. Tracks represent individual songs.\\n\\n**Track Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique track identifier. Alphanumeric characters only (A-Z, a-z, 0-9).\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Track/song title (e.g., \\\"Test Track\\\", \\\"Rock Anthem\\\")\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"track\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI (e.g., \\\"spotify:track:...\\\")\\n\\n**`href`**: (Required) API endpoint URL\\n\\n**`external_urls`**: (Required) Object with `spotify` web player URL\\n\\n**`artists`**: (Required) Array of simplified artist objects (id, name)\\n\\n**`album`**: (Required) Simplified album object with id, name, and other metadata\\n\\n**`duration_ms`**: (Required) Track length in milliseconds (integer, e.g., 180000 for 3 minutes)\\n\\n**`explicit`**: (Required) Boolean indicating explicit content\\n\\n**`popularity`**: (Required) Popularity score 0-100 (integer)\\n\\n**`track_number`**: (Optional) Position in album (integer)\\n\\n**`disc_number`**: (Optional) Disc number for multi-disc albums (integer)\\n\\n**`preview_url`**: (Optional) URL to 30-second preview MP3\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>playlists</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of playlist objects keyed by playlist ID (e.g., \\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\"). Playlists are user-created track collections.\\n\\n**Playlist Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique playlist identifier. Alphanumeric characters only (A-Z, a-z, 0-9). (e.g., \\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\")\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Playlist name (e.g., \\\"Test Playlist\\\", \\\"Workout Mix\\\")\\n\\n**`description`**: (Optional) Playlist description text\\n\\n**`owner`**: (Required) Simplified user object containing:\\n- `id`: Owner's user ID\\n- `display_name`: Owner's display name\\n- `type`: \\\"user\\\"\\n- `uri`: User URI\\n- `external_urls`: Object with `spotify` URL\\n\\n**`public`**: (Required) Boolean - true if playlist is public, false if private\\n\\n**`collaborative`**: (Required) Boolean - true if other users can modify\\n\\n**`snapshot_id`**: (Required) Version identifier (e.g., \\\"snapshot_123\\\"). Changes with every modification\\n\\n**`tracks`**: (Required) Object containing:\\n- `total`: Total number of tracks (integer)\\n- `items`: Array of playlist track objects (in full responses)\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of cover image objects (URL, height, width). May be empty\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"playlist\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI\\n\\n**`href`**: (Required) API endpoint URL\\n\\n**`external_urls`**: (Required) Object with `spotify` web player URL\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>playlist_tracks</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping playlist IDs to arrays of track items. Structure: `{playlist_id: [track_item_objects]}`.\\n\\n**Playlist Track Item:**\\n\\n**`added_at`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp when track was added (e.g., \\\"2023-01-01T00:00:00Z\\\")\\n\\n**`added_by`**: (Required) Simplified user object with id, display_name, external_urls, href, type, uri\\n\\n**`track`**: (Required) Full track object with all track metadata\\n\\n**`is_local`**: (Required) Boolean indicating if track is a local file (usually false)\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>user_playlists</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to arrays of playlist IDs they own. Structure: `{user_id: [playlist_id_strings]}`. Used by get_user_playlists and get_current_users_playlists to list a user's owned playlists.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>users</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of user objects keyed by user ID (e.g., \\\"smuqPNFPXrJKcEt943KrY8\\\"). Contains user profile information.\\n\\n**User Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique user identifier\\n\\n**`display_name`**: (Required) User's display name (e.g., \\\"Test User\\\")\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"user\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI\\n\\n**`href`**: (Required) API endpoint URL\\n\\n**`external_urls`**: (Required) Object with `spotify` profile URL\\n\\n**`followers`**: (Required) Object with follower count:\\n- `total`: Number of followers (integer)\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of profile image objects (may be empty)\\n\\n**`email`**: (Optional) Email address\\n\\n**`country`**: (Optional) ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\n**`product`**: (Optional) Subscription type: \\\"premium\\\", \\\"free\\\", etc.\\n\\n**`explicit_content`**: (Optional) Object with explicit content filter settings:\\n- `filter_enabled`: Boolean indicating if explicit content filter is enabled\\n- `filter_locked`: Boolean indicating if the setting is locked\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>categories</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of browse category objects keyed by category ID (e.g., \\\"0ZUBhfQhoczohmoxWGZpxj\\\"). Categories organize content for browsing.\\n\\n**Category Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique category identifier\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Category name (e.g., \\\"Test Category\\\", \\\"Workout\\\", \\\"Chill\\\")\\n\\n**`href`**: (Required) API endpoint URL\\n\\n**`icons`**: (Required) Array of icon image objects (may be empty)\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>shows</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of podcast show (podcast series) objects keyed by show ID. Shows represent podcast series that contain multiple episodes.\\n\\n**Show Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique show identifier\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Show/podcast name (e.g., \\\"Tech Talk Podcast\\\")\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"show\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI (e.g., \\\"spotify:show:...\\\")\\n\\n**`publisher`**: (Required) Publisher/creator of the show\\n\\n**`description`**: (Optional) Show description text\\n\\n**`available_markets`**: (Required) Array of ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes where show is available\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of image objects (URL, height, width). May be empty\\n\\n**Usage:** Used by search_for_item when searching with `type=\\\"show\\\"`.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>episodes</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of podcast episode objects keyed by episode ID. Episodes are individual podcast installments within a show.\\n\\n**Episode Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique episode identifier\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Episode title\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"episode\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI (e.g., \\\"spotify:episode:...\\\")\\n\\n**`description`**: (Optional) Episode description text\\n\\n**`duration_ms`**: (Required) Episode length in milliseconds (integer)\\n\\n**`release_date`**: (Required) Release date string\\n\\n**`show`**: (Required) Reference to parent show object with id, name, and other metadata\\n\\n**`available_markets`**: (Required) Array of ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of image objects. May be empty\\n\\n**Usage:** Used by search_for_item when searching with `type=\\\"episode\\\"` and by add_items_to_playlist/remove_playlist_items when adding/removing episodes via `spotify:episode:ID` URIs.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>audiobooks</summary>\\n\\nDictionary of audiobook objects keyed by audiobook ID. Audiobooks represent long-form audio content such as books read by narrators.\\n\\n**Audiobook Object:**\\n\\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique audiobook identifier\\n\\n**`name`**: (Required) Audiobook title\\n\\n**`type`**: (Required) Always \\\"audiobook\\\"\\n\\n**`uri`**: (Required) Spotify URI (e.g., \\\"spotify:audiobook:...\\\")\\n\\n**`authors`**: (Required) Array of author objects with name information\\n\\n**`narrators`**: (Required) Array of narrator objects with name information\\n\\n**`description`**: (Optional) Audiobook description text\\n\\n**`available_markets`**: (Required) Array of ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes\\n\\n**`images`**: (Required) Array of image objects. May be empty\\n\\n**Usage:** Used by search_for_item when searching with `type=\\\"audiobook\\\"`. Note: Audiobooks cannot be added to playlists (only tracks and episodes are supported in playlists).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>saved_albums</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to arrays of saved album IDs. Structure: `{user_id: [album_id_strings]}`. Album IDs can be used to look up full album objects in the albums collection.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>followed_artists</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to arrays of followed artist IDs. Structure: `{user_id: [artist_id_strings]}`.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>followed_playlists</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to dictionaries of followed playlists. Structure: `{user_id: {playlist_id: {\\\"public\\\": boolean, \\\"followed_at\\\": \\\"ISO_timestamp\\\"}}}`. Each playlist ID maps to an object containing whether it's followed publicly and when it was followed.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>followed_users</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to arrays of followed user IDs. Structure: `{user_id: [user_id_strings]}`.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>top_artists</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to their top listened artists. Structure: `{user_id: {\\\"artists\\\": [full_artist_objects]}}`. Used by get_user_top_artists_and_tracks.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>top_tracks</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping user IDs to their top listened tracks. Structure: `{user_id: {\\\"tracks\\\": [full_track_objects]}}`. Used by get_user_top_artists_and_tracks.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>genres</summary>\\n\\nArray of available genre seed strings (e.g., [\\\"acoustic\\\", \\\"afrobeat\\\", \\\"alt-rock\\\", \\\"alternative\\\", \\\"ambient\\\"]). Used for recommendations.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>recommendations</summary>\\n\\nStores recommendation results with tracks and seed information. Structure: `{\\\"tracks\\\": [...], \\\"seeds\\\": [...]}`.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>playlist_cover_images</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping playlist IDs to arrays of cover image objects. Structure: `{playlist_id: [{\\\"url\\\": \\\"...\\\", \\\"height\\\": 300, \\\"width\\\": 300}]}`. These are custom uploaded images set via add_custom_playlist_cover_image.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>playlist_images</summary>\\n\\nDictionary mapping playlist IDs to arrays of default playlist image objects. Structure: `{playlist_id: [{\\\"url\\\": \\\"...\\\", \\\"height\\\": 300, \\\"width\\\": 300}]}`. These are the default/generated playlist images when no custom cover has been uploaded.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>current_user</summary>\\n\\nSingle object identifying the authenticated user. Structure: `{\\\"id\\\": \\\"user_id_string\\\"}`. Points to the user in the `users` collection.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"data-structure\\\">\\n<summary>Collections for Unimplemented Features</summary>\\n\\nThe following collections exist in the database but are not currently used by any tools - the agent cannot view nor alter them. The world editor might try to include them, which can be ignored.\\n\\n**Podcasts & Audiobooks (Saved Content Only):**\\n- `chapters`: Audiobook chapter data\\n- `saved_audiobooks`: User's saved audiobooks\\n- `saved_episodes`: User's saved podcast episodes\\n- `saved_shows`: User's saved podcast shows\\n- `enhanced_audiobooks`: Extended audiobook metadata\\n- `enhanced_chapters`: Extended chapter metadata\\n- `enhanced_episodes`: Extended podcast episode metadata\\n\\n**Playback & Devices:**\\n- `playback_state`: Current playback status and context\\n- `currently_playing`: Currently playing track information\\n- `user_devices`: Available playback devices\\n- `user_queue`: User's playback queue\\n- `user_recently_played`: Recently played track history\\n\\n**Audio Analysis:**\\n- `audio_features`: Track audio features (tempo, key, energy, etc.)\\n- `audio_analysis`: Detailed audio analysis data\\n\\n**User Settings:**\\n- `user_settings`: User preferences and settings\\n- `user_subscriptions`: User subscription details\\n- `user_explicit_content_settings`: Explicit content filter settings\\n\\n**Browse & Discovery (Internal Data):**\\n- `category_playlists`: Maps categories to their playlists\\n- `featured_playlists`: Featured playlists data\\n- `recommendation_seeds`: Available seeds for recommendations\\n- `related_artists`: Maps artists to related artists\\n\\n**Social (Alternative Structures):**\\n- `playlist_followers`: Maps playlists to follower user IDs\\n- `artist_following`: Alternative structure for followed artists\\n- `user_following`: Alternative structure for followed users\\n\\n**Other:**\\n- `saved_tracks`: User's saved/liked tracks\\n- `markets`: Available market/country codes\\n- `enhanced_playlist_tracks`: Extended playlist track metadata\\n- `enhanced_devices`: Extended device information\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"read-tools\\\">\\n<summary>\\ud83d\\udcd6 Read-Only Tools</summary>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_current_user_profile</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves detailed profile information for the currently authenticated user.\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get logged-in user info for personalization\\n- Check user's subscription type (premium vs free) to enable features\\n- Display user's country for localized content\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete user object with id, display_name, type, uri, href, external_urls, followers, images, and optionally email, country, product (subscription type), and explicit_content (filter settings with filter_enabled and filter_locked booleans).\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** The current user is determined by the current_user object in the database state, which points to a user ID in the users collection. Returns the complete user object from the database without filtering any fields.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_user_profile</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves profile information for any Spotify user by their user ID.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `user_id` (required): The Spotify user ID to retrieve (e.g., \\\"SLvTb0e3Rp3oLJ8YXl0dC5\\\")\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** User ID can be obtained from e.g. get_playlist (owner field), get_current_user_profile, or search_for_item.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Display playlist owner information\\n- Check follower counts for other users\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete user object.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Returns the complete user object from the database without filtering any fields. The implementation does not distinguish between public and private user data - it returns the same structure as get_current_user_profile.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_user_top_artists_and_tracks</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves the current user's most listened to artists or tracks based on their listening history over different time periods.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `type` (required): Either \\\"artists\\\" or \\\"tracks\\\" to specify what to retrieve\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum items to return (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index for pagination (default 0)\\n\\u2022 `time_range` (optional): Time period - \\\"short_term\\\" (last 4 weeks), \\\"medium_term\\\" (last 6 months, default), or \\\"long_term\\\" (several years)\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Show user's favorite artists: `type=\\\"artists\\\", limit=10`\\n- Display top tracks over long period: `type=\\\"tracks\\\", time_range=\\\"long_term\\\"`\\n- Paginate through results: `type=\\\"artists\\\", limit=20, offset=20`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array (full artist or track objects), total count, limit, and offset for pagination.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Data is based on the user's listening history stored in `top_artists` and `top_tracks` collections in the database. Returns empty items array if user has no listening history for the specified type.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_album</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves detailed information about a single album including metadata, artists, tracks, and availability.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `album_id` (required): The Spotify album ID (e.g., \\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\")\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code to check availability (e.g., \\\"US\\\", \\\"CA\\\")\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Album ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_artists_albums, or get_users_saved_albums.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get full album details: `album_id=\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\"`\\n- Check album availability in market: `album_id=\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", market=\\\"US\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete album object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_several_albums</summary>\\n\\nEfficiently retrieves information for multiple albums in a single request, useful for batch operations.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `album_ids` (required): Array of Spotify album IDs (maximum 20)\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for availability filtering\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Album IDs can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_artists_albums, or get_users_saved_albums.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get multiple albums: `album_ids=[\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", \\\"gJIfNlJdPASNffy7UY2V6D\\\"]`\\n- Batch fetch with market filter: `album_ids=[...], market=\\\"US\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with albums array containing full album objects in the same order as requested IDs.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** More efficient than making individual get_album calls. Maximum 20 albums per request. Invalid or non-existent IDs return null in their position in the array.\\n\\n**Agent-Facing Tool Notes:**\\n> \\\"More efficient than making individual `get_album` calls. Use this function when you need information about multiple albums.\\\"\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_album_tracks</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves the track listing for a specific album with pagination support.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `album_id` (required): The Spotify album ID\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum tracks to return (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Album ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_artists_albums, or get_users_saved_albums.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get first 10 tracks: `album_id=\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", limit=10`\\n- Paginate through tracks: `album_id=\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", offset=20, limit=20`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array (track objects), total track count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Useful for albums with many tracks where you don't need to fetch the full album object. Tracks include album reference and full metadata.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_users_saved_albums</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves all albums saved to the current user's library with timestamps for when the user saved each one.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum albums to return (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get all saved albums: Paginate with increasing offset until total reached\\n- Filter by market: `market=\\\"US\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array (each item contains added_at timestamp and full album object), total saved count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>check_users_saved_albums</summary>\\n\\nChecks if one or more albums are saved in the current user's library without fetching full album data.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `album_ids` (required): Array of album IDs to check (maximum 50)\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Check single album: `album_ids=[\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\"]`\\n- Batch check multiple: `album_ids=[\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", \\\"gJIfNlJdPASNffy7UY2V6D\\\", \\\"5V17F52VsJ3ZDIF1iYxe6D\\\"]`\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of booleans in same order as input album IDs, where true means saved and false means not saved.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Very efficient for checking save status without retrieving full album data. Maximum 50 IDs per request.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_artist</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves comprehensive information about a single artist including genres, popularity, and follower count.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `artist_id` (required): The Spotify artist ID (e.g., \\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\")\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist ID can be obtained from e.g. get_album (artists field), search_for_item, or get_artists_related_artists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get artist details: `artist_id=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"`\\n- Display artist profile page with genres and popularity\\n\\n**Returns:** Full artist object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_several_artists</summary>\\n\\nEfficiently retrieves information for multiple artists in a single request.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `artist_ids` (required): Array of Spotify artist IDs (maximum 50)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist IDs can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_album (artists field), or get_artists_related_artists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Batch fetch artists: `artist_ids=[\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\", \\\"DqJ4SeZM7iQuxSkKOdQvTB\\\"]`\\n- Get all artists from an album's artist list\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with artists array containing full artist objects in the same order as requested IDs.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** More efficient than individual get_artist calls. Maximum 50 artists per request.\\n\\n**Agent-Facing Tool Notes:**\\n> \\\"More efficient than making individual `get_artist` calls. Use this function when you need information about multiple artists.\\\"\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_artists_albums</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves all albums by a specific artist with filtering and pagination support.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `artist_id` (required): The Spotify artist ID\\n\\u2022 `include_groups` (optional): Comma-separated list to filter by type - \\\"album\\\", \\\"single\\\", \\\"appears_on\\\", \\\"compilation\\\"\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum albums (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_album (artists field), or get_artists_related_artists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get all albums: `artist_id=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"`\\n- Filter albums only: `artist_id=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\", include_groups=\\\"album\\\"`\\n- Get singles: `artist_id=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\", include_groups=\\\"single\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array containing full album objects, total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_artists_top_tracks</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves an artist's most popular tracks in a specific market/country.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `artist_id` (required): The Spotify artist ID\\n\\u2022 `market` (required): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (e.g., \\\"US\\\", \\\"GB\\\")\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist ID can be obtained from e.g. get_album, search_for_item, or get_artists_related_artists. Market parameter is required as popularity varies by region.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get US top tracks: `artist_id=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\", market=\\\"US\\\"`\\n- Display artist's hit songs in user's country\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with tracks array containing up to 10 full track objects, sorted by popularity (highest first).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_artists_related_artists</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves artists similar to the specified artist based on genre overlap.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `artist_id` (required): The Spotify artist ID\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist ID can be obtained from e.g. get_album, search_for_item, or artists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Find similar artists: `artist_id=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with artists array containing up to 20 full artist objects similar to the input artist.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:**\\nReturns artists that share at least one genre with the input artist, sorted by popularity (highest first), limited to 20 results. Similarity is binary - any genre overlap qualifies an artist as related, regardless of how many genres are shared. An artist sharing 1 genre is treated the same as one sharing 5 genres; ranking is determined solely by popularity.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_playlist</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves complete information about a specific playlist including tracks, owner, and metadata.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `playlist_id` (required): The Spotify playlist ID (e.g., \\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\")\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\u2022 `fields` (optional): Comma-separated list of fields to return (filters response)\\n\\u2022 `additional_types` (optional): Comma-separated list - \\\"track\\\", \\\"episode\\\" (default is track only)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Playlist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_current_users_playlists, get_user_playlists, or get_category_playlists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get full playlist: `playlist_id=\\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\"`\\n- Filter specific fields: `playlist_id=\\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\", fields=\\\"name,owner,tracks.total\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete playlist object with name, description, owner, public/collaborative flags, snapshot_id, tracks object with items array, images, and URLs.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_playlist_items</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves the track/episode items in a playlist with detailed metadata about when and by whom they were added.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `playlist_id` (required): The Spotify playlist ID\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\u2022 `fields` (optional): Comma-separated list of fields to filter response\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum items (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\u2022 `additional_types` (optional): \\\"track\\\", \\\"episode\\\" or both\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Playlist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_current_users_playlists, get_user_playlists, or get_category_playlists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get first 20 tracks: `playlist_id=\\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\", limit=20`\\n- Paginate through large playlist: `playlist_id=\\\"...\\\", offset=40, limit=20`\\n- Get only specific fields: `fields=\\\"items(added_at,track(name,artists))\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array (each item has added_at, added_by, track, and is_local fields), total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_current_users_playlists</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves playlists owned by the current authenticated user (does not include followed playlists).\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum playlists (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- List user's playlists: `limit=20`\\n- Get all playlists: Paginate until all fetched\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array (full playlist objects), total count, limit, and offset. Playlists are returned in the order they were first created.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_user_playlists</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves all public playlists owned by a specific user (not playlists they follow).\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `user_id` (required): The Spotify user ID\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum playlists (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** User ID can be obtained from e.g. get_playlist (owner field), get_current_user_profile, or search_for_item.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- View another user's playlists: `user_id=\\\"SLvTb0e3Rp3oLJ8YXl0dC5\\\", limit=20`\\n- Browse creator's playlists on their profile page\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with items array (public playlist objects owned by the user), total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_playlist_cover_image</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves the cover image(s) for a specific playlist in multiple resolutions.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `playlist_id` (required): The Spotify playlist ID\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Playlist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_current_users_playlists, get_user_playlists, or get_category_playlists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get playlist cover art: `playlist_id=\\\"QDyH69WryQ7dPRXVOFmy2V\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of image objects, each with url, height, and width. May be empty if no cover image is set.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>check_user_follows_playlist</summary>\\n\\nChecks if one or more users are following a specific playlist.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `playlist_id` (required): The Spotify playlist ID\\n\\u2022 `user_ids` (required): Array of user IDs to check (maximum 5)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Playlist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item or get_current_users_playlists. User IDs can be obtained from get_current_user_profile or get_playlist (owner field).\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Check if current user follows: `playlist_id=\\\"...\\\", user_ids=[\\\"smuqPNFPXrJKcEt943KrY8\\\"]`\\n- Check multiple users: `playlist_id=\\\"...\\\", user_ids=[\\\"smuqPNFPXrJKcEt943KrY8\\\", \\\"SLvTb0e3Rp3oLJ8YXl0dC5\\\"]`\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of booleans in same order as input user IDs, where true means following and false means not following.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Very efficient for batch checking.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>check_user_follows_artists_or_users</summary>\\n\\nChecks if the current user follows one or more artists or users.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `ids` (required): Array of Spotify IDs to check (maximum 50)\\n\\u2022 `type` (required): Either \\\"artist\\\" or \\\"user\\\" to specify what type of IDs are provided\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist IDs can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_album, or get_artists_related_artists. User IDs can be obtained from get_current_user_profile or get_playlist (owner field).\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Check artist follows: `ids=[\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\", \\\"DqJ4SeZM7iQuxSkKOdQvTB\\\"], type=\\\"artist\\\"`\\n- Check user follows: `ids=[\\\"SLvTb0e3Rp3oLJ8YXl0dC5\\\"], type=\\\"user\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of booleans in same order as input IDs, indicating follow status for each.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Efficient for batch checking follow status on browse pages.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_followed_artists</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves all artists that the current user follows with pagination support.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum artists (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `after` (optional): Last artist ID from previous request for cursor-based pagination\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get followed artists: `limit=20`\\n- Cursor pagination: `limit=20, after=\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"`\\n- Show user's followed artists library\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with artists object containing items array (full artist objects), total count, and cursor information.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Uses cursor-based pagination with \\\"after\\\" parameter instead of offset. The after value should be the last artist ID from the previous response. \\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_categories</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves all browse categories available on Spotify for content discovery.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `country` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for localized categories (not used - can be set but will not be applied)\\n\\u2022 `locale` (optional): Language code (e.g., \\\"en_US\\\", \\\"es_MX\\\") for category names (not used - can be set but will not be applied)\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum categories (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get all categories: `limit=50`\\n- Localized categories: `country=\\\"US\\\", locale=\\\"en_US\\\"`\\n- Paginate: `limit=20, offset=20`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with categories object containing items array (category objects with id, name, icons), total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_category</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves detailed information about a specific browse category.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `category_id` (required): The Spotify category ID (e.g., \\\"0ZUBhfQhoczohmoxWGZpxj\\\")\\n\\u2022 `country` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\u2022 `locale` (optional): Language code for localized name\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Category ID must exist in the database. Can be obtained from get_categories.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get category details: `category_id=\\\"0ZUBhfQhoczohmoxWGZpxj\\\"`\\n- Localized category: `category_id=\\\"...\\\", locale=\\\"es_MX\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Category object with id, name, icons array, and href.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Returns category metadata only (id, name, icons, href), not any items within that category.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_category_playlists</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves playlists. Returns playlists with this category.\\n\\n**BUG - will return ALL playlists, not just those for the set category**\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `category_id` (required): The Spotify category ID\\n\\u2022 `country` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (not used - can be set but will not be applied)\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum playlists (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Category ID must exist. Can be obtained from get_categories.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get Workout category playlists: `category_id=\\\"Mora0MAirzOLgW875YAWag\\\", limit=20`\\n- Country-specific playlists: `category_id=\\\"...\\\", country=\\\"US\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with playlists object containing items array of all playlist objects, total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:**\\n\\u26a0\\ufe0f **Simulation limitation:**\\n- The tool does not effectively filter playlists by category - it returns all playlists from the playlists collection regardless of which category was specified.\\n- The country parameter is validated but not used for filtering results.\\n- You can still use this tool and its output for testing the agent's calls for category-based playlist browsing, but be aware that the returned playlists will not actually be specific to the requested category and will need further filtering.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_featured_playlists</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves all playlists from Spotify DB as \\\"featured\\\".\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `country` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (not used)\\n\\u2022 `locale` (optional): Language code for localized content (not used)\\n\\u2022 `timestamp` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp for time-specific recommendations (e.g., \\\"2023-01-01T12:00:00\\\") (not used)\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum playlists (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get current featured playlists: `country=\\\"US\\\", limit=10`\\n- Time-specific features: `timestamp=\\\"2023-12-31T23:00:00\\\", country=\\\"US\\\"`\\n- Browse tab featured section: `limit=20`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with optional message string and playlists object containing items array, total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:**\\n\\u26a0\\ufe0f **Limitation:**\\n- Returns all playlists from the playlists collection as \\\"featured\\\" regardless of actual featured status.\\n- The country, locale, and timestamp parameters can be set but are not used by the tool to filter the results.\\n- You can still use this tool to test the agent's calls in your tasks, but be aware that all playlists are treated as featured.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_new_releases</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves newest-released albums on Spotify, useful for discovering fresh music.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `country` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code to filter by regional availability\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum albums (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get new releases: `limit=20`\\n- Country-specific releases: `country=\\\"US\\\", limit=10`\\n- Paginate through releases: `offset=20, limit=20`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with albums object containing items array (simplified album objects), total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Returns all albums from the database sorted by release_date (newest first).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_available_genre_seeds</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves the complete list of genre seeds available for generating recommendations. **Seeds** are input parameters for get_recommendations that specify what type of music to find (artist, track, or genre-based).\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Build genre filter for music discovery\\n- Validate genre seeds before calling get_recommendations\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with genres array containing available genre seed strings (e.g., [\\\"acoustic\\\", \\\"afrobeat\\\", \\\"alt-rock\\\", \\\"alternative\\\", \\\"ambient\\\", ...]).\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Returns the genre list stored in the database (10 genres in default DB). These exact genre strings must be used when calling get_recommendations with seed_genres parameter.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_recommendations</summary>\\n\\nGenerates track recommendations based on seed artists, tracks, and/or genres. Seeds are meant to influence recommendations (e.g., \\\"find tracks similar to this artist/genre/track\\\").\\n\\n**bug - tool will not apply seeds**\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `seed_artists` (optional): Array of artist IDs (up to 5 total seeds combined)\\n\\u2022 `seed_genres` (optional): Array of genre strings from get_available_genre_seeds (up to 5 total seeds combined)\\n\\u2022 `seed_tracks` (optional): Array of track IDs (up to 5 total seeds combined)\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Number of recommendations (1-100, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** At least one seed (artist, genre, or track) must be provided. Total seeds cannot exceed 5. Genre seeds must be from get_available_genre_seeds list.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Artist-based radio: `seed_artists=[\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"], limit=20`\\n- Genre discovery: `seed_genres=[\\\"rock\\\", \\\"jazz\\\"], limit=30`\\n- Mixed seeds: `seed_artists=[\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"], seed_tracks=[\\\"WSB9PMCMqpdEBFpMrMfS3h\\\"], seed_genres=[\\\"pop\\\"]`\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with tracks array (full track objects) and seeds array (echoes back the provided seeds with metadata).\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:**\\n\\u26a0\\ufe0f **Simulation limitation:**\\n- The tool does not effectively filter by seed input - it will accept the seed parameters, but only returns tracks from the database filtered by market parameter.\\n- You can still use this tool, instructing the agent to use certain seed parameters to get recommendations and using its output if the call itself was correct, but be aware that the actual list will not reflect the seed input values.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>search_for_item</summary>\\n\\nSearches Spotify's catalog for content matching a query string across multiple types including music, podcasts, and audiobooks.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `q` (required): Search query string. \\u26a0\\ufe0f Uses simple case-insensitive substring matching on the names of the item type set by the `type` parameter only (i.e. a search for albums will only check the names of albums, not any tracks or artists). Does not support boolean operators (AND, OR, NOT) or advanced search syntax (field filters like artist:, album:, wildcards, etc.)\\n\\u2022 `type` (required): Comma-separated types to search - \\\"album\\\", \\\"artist\\\", \\\"playlist\\\", \\\"track\\\", \\\"show\\\" (podcast series), \\\"episode\\\" (podcast episode), \\\"audiobook\\\"\\n\\u2022 `market` (optional): ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum items per type (1-50, default 20)\\n\\u2022 `offset` (optional): Starting index (default 0)\\n\\u2022 `include_external` (optional): \\\"audio\\\" to include externally hosted content\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Search tracks: `q=\\\"Test\\\", type=\\\"track\\\"`\\n- Multi-type search: `q=\\\"Popular\\\", type=\\\"artist,album,playlist\\\"`\\n- Search podcasts: `q=\\\"Tech Talk\\\", type=\\\"show,episode\\\"`\\n- Search audiobooks: `q=\\\"Harry Potter\\\", type=\\\"audiobook\\\"`\\n- No results case: `q=\\\"nonexistent_xyz\\\", type=\\\"track\\\"` returns empty results\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with keys for each searched type (e.g., tracks, artists, albums, shows, episodes, audiobooks), each containing object with items array, total count, limit, and offset.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Can search multiple types in one call. Each type gets its own pagination. Returns empty arrays (total: 0) for no matches, doesn't error.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"write-tools\\\">\\n<summary>\\u270f\\ufe0f State-Changing Tools</summary>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>save_albums_for_user</summary>\\n\\nSaves one or more albums to the current user's personal library for easy access.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `album_ids` (required): Array of album IDs to save (maximum 50)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Album IDs can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_artists_albums, get_album, or get_new_releases.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Save single album: `album_ids=[\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\"]`\\n- Batch save albums user discovers: `album_ids=[\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", \\\"gJIfNlJdPASNffy7UY2V6D\\\", \\\"5V17F52VsJ3ZDIF1iYxe6D\\\"]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds albums to the current user's saved_albums collection with current timestamp as added_at. If album is already saved, no duplicate is created (idempotent operation).\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with message: \\\"The album is saved\\\".\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>remove_albums_for_user</summary>\\n\\nRemoves one or more albums from the current user's personal library.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `album_ids` (required): Array of album IDs to remove (maximum 50)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Album IDs from get_users_saved_albums.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Remove single album: `album_ids=[\\\"5V17F52VsJ3ZDIF1iYxe6D\\\"]`\\n- Batch remove: `album_ids=[\\\"4kBp5iVByDSAUc0lb78jCZ\\\", \\\"gJIfNlJdPASNffy7UY2V6D\\\", \\\"5V17F52VsJ3ZDIF1iYxe6D\\\"]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes specified albums from the current user's saved_albums collection entry. Removes the entire saved album object including the added_at timestamp.\\n\\n**Returns:** Object with message: \\\"Album(s) have been removed from the library\\\".\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Idempotent operation - removing an album that isn't saved doesn't cause an error. The album remains in the global catalog, only the user's save relationship is removed.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>follow_artists_or_users</summary>\\n\\nAdds the current user as a follower of one or more artists or users.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `ids` (required): Array of Spotify IDs to follow (maximum 50)\\n\\u2022 `type` (required): Either \\\"artist\\\" or \\\"user\\\" to specify what type to follow\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist IDs can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_album, get_artists_related_artists, or get_followed_artists. User IDs can be obtained from get_current_user_profile or get_playlist (owner field).\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Follow artists: `ids=[\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\", \\\"DqJ4SeZM7iQuxSkKOdQvTB\\\"], type=\\\"artist\\\"`\\n- Follow single user: `ids=[\\\"SLvTb0e3Rp3oLJ8YXl0dC5\\\"], type=\\\"user\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds the specified IDs to the current user's followed_artists or followed_users collection depending on type. Following an artist adds you to their follower count.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success confirmation.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Entire call will fail if any one ID is invalid\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>unfollow_artists_or_users</summary>\\n\\nRemoves the current user as a follower of one or more artists or users.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `ids` (required): Array of Spotify IDs to unfollow (maximum 50)\\n\\u2022 `type` (required): Either \\\"artist\\\" or \\\"user\\\"\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Artist IDs can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_album, get_artists_related_artists, or get_followed_artists. User IDs can be obtained from get_current_user_profile or get_playlist (owner field).\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Unfollow artists: `ids=[\\\"W0e71GNltAWtwmOaMZcm1J\\\"], type=\\\"artist\\\"`\\n- Unfollow multiple users: `ids=[\\\"smuqPNFPXrJKcEt943KrY8\\\", \\\"SLvTb0e3Rp3oLJ8YXl0dC5\\\"], type=\\\"user\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes the specified IDs from the current user's followed_artists or followed_users collection. Decrements the follower count for artists.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success confirmation.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Idempotent - unfollowing entities you don't follow doesn't cause errors.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>follow_playlist</summary>\\n\\nAdds the current user as a follower of a playlist, adding it to their library.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `playlist_id` (required): The Spotify playlist ID to follow\\n\\u2022 `public` (optional): Whether to follow publicly (default true). If false, follow is private\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Playlist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_user_playlists, get_category_playlists, or get_featured_playlists.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Follow publicly: `playlist_id=\\\"UgsCJJwpTgHzXvFg3QW3yQ\\\", public=true`\\n- Follow privately: `playlist_id=\\\"UgsCJJwpTgHzXvFg3QW3yQ\\\", public=false`\\n- Add playlist to library: Follow to add to user's playlist collection\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds playlist to current user's followed_playlists collection with the public flag. Publicly followed playlists appear in the user's public profile, private follows do not.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success confirmation.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** Unlike artists/users, playlists have a public/private follow distinction. The public parameter can be changed later by following again with a different value.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>unfollow_playlist</summary>\\n\\nRemoves the current user as a follower of a playlist, removing it from their library.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `playlist_id` (required): The Spotify playlist ID to unfollow\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Playlist ID can be obtained from e.g. search_for_item, get_user_playlists, get_category_playlists, or get_featured_playlists; no error if not following.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Unfollow playlist: `playlist_id=\\\"UgsCJJwpTgHzXvFg3QW3yQ\\\"`\\n- Remove from library: Clean up followed playlists\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes playlist from current user's followed_playlists collection entry. Both public and private follows are removed.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success confirmation.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_playlist</summary>\\n\\nCreates a new empty playlist owned by the specified user. New playlists start empty (0 tracks) and can be added to in a subsequent call to `add_items_to_playlist`.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `user_id` (required): The Spotify user ID who will own the playlist\\n\\u2022 `name` (required): Playlist name (e.g., \\\"My Workout Mix\\\")\\n\\u2022 `public` (optional): Whether playlist is public (default true).
